bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, December 31, 1886
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the U.S. Monrovia Dec. 31, 1886
To the Asst Secty of State
Funeral Expenses of the late Minster Moses A. Hopkins. Re-shipment of goods sent by Despatch Agent of New York.
Funderal Expenses- reshipment of goods- payment of G. T. Moove & Son.
Consulate General of the U.S. Monrovia Dec. 31/86
Hon. Jas D. Porter- Asst Secty of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you that your despatch no. 12 dated Sept 24th 1886 authorizing me to dispose of the goods of the late Minister Moses A Hopkins in order to pay his funeral expenses could not well be performed. G. T. Moove & Son to whom the government is indebted for the funeral expenses would

would not take them to their account; nor could I dispose of them to her profit to any murchant here; therefore by her request and by my own judgement, I have shipped said goods back to her with the rest of afects the left of her husband to her home in Franklinton Franklin County N. C. I have also paid G Moove & Son for funeral expenses.
Hoping to receive your approval for steps taken
I am sir your obedient servant
Samuel S. Service Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
